Job Description
Neurodegenerative Behavior Scientist - PhD

Located near Fair Lawn, NJ

Please see other Life Sciences job opportunities at www.scientificsearch.com

Qualified candidate must be a motivated, talented and disciplined scientist having excellent expertise in behaviorally assessing various rodent models of neurodegenerative disease. In addition the successful candidate should have prior experience with stereotactic surgeries in rodents. Applicants must possess a Ph.D. degree in Neuroscience or a related field, or MS with at least 5 to 10 years of experience. Superior communication skills, experience in motivating and supervising junior Research Associates, ability to multi-task and a demonstrated record of accomplishment are a must. Applicant must be willing to work in the back with junior Research Associates, providing scientific and technical support.

Requirements: Knowledgeable in Performing experiments using behavior assays assessing motor and cognitive dysfunction; Strong Stereotaxic and general surgery skills are a must; Excel in data handling, including statistical analysis; Hands on experience with rodent handling, tissue dissection, blood collection, drug administration (IV, IP, PO, ICV) are required. Ensure that presentations and reports are available to clients in a timely manner. Contribute to manuscript preparation as needed. Demonstrate strong leadership skills, train and supervise scientists as needed.

Major plus: Background in neurodegenerative research with in vivo molecular and pharmacological expertise.
Company Description
Since 1983, Scientific Search has been placing technical, management, and executive level professionals. We have been named one of the fastest growing, privately held companies in South Jersey by the Philadelphia Business Journal six times, and one of the prestigious Philadelphia 100 companies on four occasions including this past year. We are also a member of the nationally recognized Inc. 5000. In 2015, we were recognized as one of the best places to work in NJ.
